page.title: 09Education 1
page.content: The southern region of Truro contains the greater quantity of educational institutions; there are 3 primary,1 secondary, and 2 private schools. Kea Primary school serves the rural areas whereas Bosvigo serves the main urban area - with about 8 schools in Truro for this 5 to 11 age group, these 2 schools have their own nucleus of settlements. Teachers cover a wide range of subjects with a class of one particular age group. Sports resources and facilities are limited due to the size of the schools. In this area Secondary education comprises 1 state school,Richard Lander, which serves 50% of the total urban and rural school population of Truro, and 2 private schools, Truro School and Truro High School, all of which cater for 11 to 18 year olds.
